data.title: [Windows 8] Song play issue
data.body:
When trying to play songs, the playback will fail.

Steps to reproduce:
Play a song (MediaPlayer.Play(...))
Make sure that MediaPlayer.IsRepeating is false

``` C#
MediaPlayer.MediaStateChanged += (sender, e) =>
{
    if (MediaPlayer.State == MediaState.Stopped) // Song just ended, play again
        MediaPlayer.Play(...);
}
```

When the event calls Play(), the execution stop at the following statement:
_mediaEngineEx.Source = converted; (Line 285)

No exception will be thrown.

If Play is called again, the game will freeze (even checking if MediaEngineEX has an error makes the game freeze).

data.title: Constructor Plane(Vector3 a, Vector3 b, Vector3 c) has error
Guide Implementation for WP8
data.body:
This commit implements various Guide methods on WP8.

I did this using the little known [C# extern alias feature](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ansonh/archive/2006/09/28/extern-alias-walkthrough.aspx).

This means MonoGame for WP8 references the Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamerServices and Microsoft.Xna.Framework assemblies simply to redirect the MonoGame call to Microsoft's Guide implementation.

In testing this in the emulator and on a WP8 device I saw no visible difference in loading times or functionality by using this technique.  MessageBox on WP8 looks and behaves identical to how it works in Microsoft XNA.

It would be useful for others to give it a try and see if they have the same results as I did.

data.title: Fixed Equals method in Vector2.cs, where it compared with itself rath...
data.body: The Equals method in Vector2 compared with itself (this) rather than the supplied parameter (obj).

data.title: WinRT Fixes
data.body:
- Fixed missing file in Win8 build.
- Added lock() around Present.

data.title: Fixes Windows8 build, adding EffectMaterialReader and few more classes.
Fix issue #965 - PSS should be PSM now
data.body:
- Done using search & replace for the regex pattern:
  (#._)(PSS)(._)
  Replace with: \1PSM\3
- Also replaced constants in 2 .csproj files.

data.title: csproj had not been updated to reference GamePage*, instead of MainPage*
data.body:
Basically the csproj was still referring to MainPage, when it should be referring to GamePage, as per a recent change. This PR fixes that, so that the template works correctly.
Just need the WindowsPhone8 assembly for it to work.

data.title: Fix reloading of graphics resources when device is resetting - Android
data.body:
This problem originated with https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/905

The new approach with the GraphicsResource.GraphicsDeviceResetting() methods was good, except that the methods were never called due to not being overrides.

Also, it is necessary for this to be called in OnDeviceResetting, not OnDeviceReset.

data.title: MonoGame and Lidgren.Network assemblies not copied to output folder from the project templates.
data.body:
In the project templates for Mac (Both C# and the F# one I added ) the MonoGame and Lidgren.Network dll's are not copied to the output folder.

I know there is the code in:
`PopulateSupportFileList(FileCopySet list, ConfigurationSelector solutionConfiguration){...}`
to address MD not local-copying package references.   [MonoDevelop bug 4030](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=4030)

I also have been using a package config file that points to my compiled dlls's so that the project references don't show up as missing in MD:

```
Name: monogame
Description: MonoGame.Framework.MacOS
Version: 2.0.0.0
Libs: -r:/Users/dave/code/7sharp9MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/bin/Release/MonoGame.Framework.MacOS.dll -r:/Users/dave/code/7sharp9MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/bin/Release/Lidgren.Network.dll
```

Maybe this will be all resolved when the installer is complete for the Mac, but it would be nice to get this working in a development environment as the v3.0 build will probably be in flux for some time and I think getting the starter project simple to installed and use would drive adoption and experimentation

data.title: Added fix for F# project template
data.body:
Added fix for F# project template item not being copied to the output folder.  
Added assembly info for F# template.

data.title: Removed duplicated using System.Collections.Generic & #if-ed an iPhone block
data.body:
Compiling the latest version of WinRT appears not to be working because of this duplicated using

(it's my first batch of pull request, please be kind ;)  )

data.title: No Texture parameter for PSM Simulator
data.body: PSM BasicEffect does not have a "Texture" parameter when running in the PSM simulator. This doesn't appear when running on the Vita hardware.

data.title: PSM Accelerometer Needs To Match The Input Device API
data.body:
The PSM Accelerometer support (if it ever worked) needs to updated to reflect the interface that is available in the Microsoft accelerometer class.

Accelerometer in PSM is a static class, and that needs to be switched to a non-static class so that it can be instantiated.

data.title: PSS should be PSM now
data.body: References to build constant PSS should be changed to PSM because PSS is a defunct name for the PlayStation Mobile platform.

data.title: Touch Fixes
data.body:
First a potentially better fix for pull... https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/937

Also a fix for gesture events getting delayed for a few frames.

Please don't merge this until it has been discussed.

data.title: Misc Fixes
data.body: A couple of miscellaneous fixes.

data.title: Fixed the project references for the Windows 8 App Store Projects
data.body: as the description says

data.title: Mac: Mouse position not updated when mouse outside window
data.body: When I leave the game window on OS X 10.8.2 the X- and Y-coordinates of the MouseState returned by Mouse.GetState() aren't updated and keep the last value. On Windows they're still updated after leaving the game window. This behavior is important for implementing mouse locking used in first person games.

data.title: iOS - Build fixed; added missing files to csproj
data.body: Builds for iOS were failing due to missing files in MonoGame.Framework.iOS.csproj.

data.title: [3develop, iOS] No class named NSApplication is loaded.
No Sound Hardware Fix For WinRT
data.body: This fix allows SoundEffect and SoundEffectInstance to function even if no sound hardware is available on the machine.  Before the game would crash if you tried to work with sound classes if no sound device was available.

data.title: Added missing Leaderboard* and misc GamerServices classes
data.body: I think I got most, if not all of them. Only added to iOS project in this commit, may add to others in the next one.

data.title: Crash on VertexBuffer.Dispose()
data.body:
After exiting a game scene, and having unreferenced most of the resources used on that scene, the game crashed on the VertexBuffer.GraphicsDevice property, because the GraphicsDevice WeakReference was finalized before.

I never called Dispose() directly on that VertexBuffer. I should do it (and will do), but it shouldn't crash anyway, right?

data.title: Added Windows Phone 8 project template.
data.body: See if this works for you.

data.title: Changed IPHONE to IOS per issue 950.
data.body: This is a global search and replace on IPHONE to be IOS per issue 954. Affected csproj files and cs files. Did the same for the samples module, but that is not part of this PR.

data.title: Linux: Garbled vertices, keyboard input doesn't work?
data.body:
I've started trying MonoGame on Linux. After getting past the crash on startup ( #915 ) I got to a point when the game started, but most of the geometry was shown incorrectly.

I can't tell for sure (I'm not very experienced with Linux development, so I'm rather slow debugging there), but I think only geometry drawn using DrawUserPrimitives (or DrawUserIndexedPrimitives) is affected: The data comming from .xnb assets is shown fine, with the shaders loading fine etc.

Also it looks like keyboard input didn't work at all, so I couldn't get to try the game past the main menu.

Anyway, getting the game even to the main menu is a great thing, so congrats on your hard work :).

I'm using a freshly installed Ubuntu 12.10 , with updated nVidia drivers (or so I think...)

data.title: Support for sampler and render states in effect files
data.body: The bulk of it is in 21cf360. The other commits fix random issues I've run into.

data.body:
Framework/Content/ContentReaders/

    ExternalReferenceReader.cs

Framewrork/Graphics/Effects/

These are not referenced in the PSM project file.

data.title: Replace IPHONE Compile Directives with IOS
data.body:
Request is to discard the use of IPHONE as a compile directive and use IOS instead. See issue 944:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/944#issuecomment-10127896
